result.execSummary:
The defendant Alfred L Poston Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil judgment entered for restitution owed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution hearing held on March 3/22/2016  Court orders restitution amount may be offset by any amount from the civil personal injury ligitation that is currently pending. Restitution amount is for victim M.D. only as other victim was not present in court for the restitution hearing. The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Total court costs due during the term of probation.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the governmental entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:

**2/23/2017 - Court hearing held, additional 60 day stayed jail term will not be imposed.

DAR RECORDER - 02:40 PM Defendant Alfred L Poston in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DOC agent Jason Simenow appears.  Court converts restitution/costs to a civil judgment. Defendant to be discharged from probation on his release date.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Jeffrey Sisley appears for the State of Wisconsin. DOC Agent Jason Siminow appears. Defendant did not appear. records.addlTxt: Defendant Alfred L Poston not in court. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court will not impose additional 60 days jail term.
-Amended as to restitution amount

Attorney John P Carlson in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Carlson states defendant is currently at employment on huber. Court is informed one of the victims is ill and cannot be present in court today. Victim, M.D., is present in court and is requesting restitution in the amount of $26,435.79 and the other victim is requesting restitution in the amount of $12,533.81.  Court is informed there is a civil case that is pending which may result in a settlement as to the restitution amounts. Court orders restitution amount of $26,435.79 to victim M.D. Court orders the restitution amount be offset by any amount from the civil personal injury litigation pending. Court does not make a finding as to the restitution amount of $12,533.81 because the victim is not in court.
Review hearing at 02-23-2017 04:00 pm
Restitution hearing at 03-22-2016 03:00 pm

Counsel files plea questionnaire. State files amended information. Court examines defendant and renders sentence.  
Restitution hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
